    • trap

      public void trap(Consumer<Throwable> consumer)
      Description copied from interface: Try
      Performs the given action on the caught Throwable if this Try is a Failure. Does nothing if this Try is a Success. It's like void consume(Consumer<T>); for the Throwable.
      Specified by:
      trap in interface Try<T>
      Parameters:
      consumer - The action

      public Try<T> filter(Predicate<T> predicate)
      Description copied from interface: Try
      Converts this to a Failure if the predicate on the value is not satisfied.
      Specified by:
      filter in interface Try<T>
      Parameters:
      predicate - a predicate which test the value.
      Returns:

    • filterThrowable

      public Try<T> filterThrowable(Predicate<Throwable> predicate)
      Description copied from interface: Try
      Converts this to a Failure if the predicate on the throwable is not satisfied.
      Specified by:
      filterThrowable in interface Try<T>
      Parameters:
      predicate - a predicate which test the throwable.
      Returns:
      this if it's a Failure and the the caught Throwable match the given predicate, a Failure containing a UnsupportedOperationException if it's a Success, a Failure containing a NoSuchElementException otherwise

    • failed

      public Try<Throwable> failed()
      Description copied from interface: Try
      Inverts this Try. Returns its exception wrapped in a Success if it's a Failure or a Failure containing an UnsupportedOperationException if it's a Success.
      Specified by:
      failed in interface Try<T>
      Returns:
      a Try<Throwable>

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object).
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code value for this object. The value is derived from the hash code of each of the record components.
      Specified by:
      hashCode in class Record
      Returns:
      a hash code value for this object

    • toString

      public final String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this record class. The representation contains the name of the class, followed by the name and value of each of the record components.
      Specified by:
      toString in class Record
      Returns:
      a string representation of this object
